New Records: J.T. Realmuto recorded an RBI single in the bottom of the ninth inning to secure the win.
Harold Bohm hit a solo home run in the sixth inning.
The Philadelphia Phillies secured a 5-4 victory over the New York Mets, their second straight win.
Key Match Events: The game was decided in the bottom of the ninth inning when J.T. Realmuto delivered a crucial RBI single to right field, scoring Cody Bellinger and giving the Phillies a 5-4 lead.
Harold Bohm's solo home run in the sixth inning provided an early boost for the Phillies, extending their lead to 3-1.
The New York Mets' bullpen struggled in the ninth inning, allowing two runs on two hits, including a game-ending single by Realmuto.
Post-Match Reflections: J.T. Realmuto expressed relief and pride after the Phillies' come-from-behind win, stating it was a great team effort.
Phillies manager Dave Roberts highlighted the victory as a significant step in their push towards the playoffs, emphasizing the team's resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a tightly contested affair, with both teams exchanging leads throughout the nine innings.
The win marked the Phillies' second consecutive victory, solidifying their position in the playoff race.
